page.title: 18LANGAR IN THE 30'S
page.content: Langar consisted of{30}houses. Most of the homes had only a cold tap and water often came also from wells and pumps. Many people had large families and the school contanied about {100}pupils aged {5-14}.The Stanley family of Barnstone had {13}children for example. The children worked in the school garden for funds. The village had two buses a week in {1934}.They ran to Nottingham.The fare cost {1 shilling}and{6 pence }for {12 miles}. Very few people had cars. The ones who did mostly owned model 'T' Fords. Most people worked on the farms or did their jobs around the village.At this time the gentleman at Langar Hall played cricket for the { {M.C.C.}Frequent visitors were Douglas Jardine and C.B.Fry the famous cricketers.
